intro: Melittis graeca, commonly known as the Greek melittis, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Mediterranean region. The plant is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade.
